data.name: strDefFileBrowserTitle
data.value: Please locate the file

data.name: strDefFolderBrowserTitle
data.value: Please locate the folder

data.name: strEmojiAnimateEndlessly
data.value: Animate All Emoji

data.name: strEmojiAnimateEndlesslyToolTip
data.value: Causes all emoji to be animated endlessly. Your theme will choose the animation.

data.name: strEmojiAnimateLimit
data.value: Limit Emoji Animation

data.name: strEmojiAnimateLimitToolTip
data.value: This is a cross between the other two. The emoji will animate, but stop after a couple loops through the animation. Your theme selects the animation.

data.name: strEmojiAnimateNever
data.value: Never Animate Emoji

data.name: strEmojiAnimateNeverToolTip
data.value: Selecting this will prevent animated emoji. Some people find them distracting.

data.name: strEmojiDisplayingAsEmoticons
data.value: Display as plain text emoticons

data.name: strEmojiDisplayingAsEmoticonsToolTiop
data.value: If you select this, Best Chat will display any emoji you receive as though you received plain text emoji. Regardless, you'll be about to hover your mouse over the emoticon shown and see what actually arrived and how to send that emoji back.

data.name: strEmojiDisplayingLeaveAlone
data.value: Leave Alone

data.name: strEmojiDisplayingLeaveAloneToolTip
data.value: If you select this, Best Chat will display any emoji as received. Regardless, you'll be able to move your mouse over the emoji to see what was actually received and what you can enter to get the same emoji.

data.name: strEmojiSendingConvertToEmoticons
data.value: Convert to emotions

data.name: strEmojiSendingConvertToEmoticonsToolTip
data.value: Best Chat will convert emoji you enter into emoticons. This is safer as not all clients can correctly handle emoji.

data.name: strEmojiSendingLeaveAlone
data.value: Leave Alone

data.name: strEmojiSendingLeaveAloneToolTip
data.value: Best Chat will send any emoji you enter as is. Emoji might not be handled correctly by some clients.

data.name: strEmoticonDisplayingAsEmojiToolTip
data.value: Causes Best Chat to act as though an emoji were sent instead of an emoticon. Hover your mouse over the emoji to see what was actually sent and how to sent that emoji back. The emoji dipslay option can allow that emoji to be animated in which case your theme chooses the animation.

data.name: strEmoticonDisplayingDisplayAsEmoji
data.value: Display as Emoji

data.name: strEmoticonDisplayingLeaveAlone
data.value: Leave Alone

data.name: strEmoticonDisplayingLeaveAloneToolTip
data.value: If you select this, Best Chat will never convert emoticons into emoji for you. However, if you hover over the emoticon, you'll see a graphical depiction of it. Depending on the emoji display option below, your theme will select an animation to play.

data.name: strEmoticonSendingConvertToEmoji
data.value: Convert to Emoji

data.name: strEmoticonSendingConvertToEmojiToolTip
data.value: Causes Best Chat to send out the emoticons you type as emoji.

data.name: strEmoticonSendingLeaveAlone
data.value: Leave Alone

data.name: strEmoticonSendingLeaveAloneToolTip
data.value: Not all clients handle emoji correctly. This option ensure emoticons go out as plain ASCII which they should be able to handle just fine.

data.name: strFontWeightBold
data.value: Bold

data.name: strFontWeightDemiBold
data.value: Demi Bold

data.name: strFontWeightExtraBlack
data.value: Extra Black

data.name: strFontWeightExtraBold
data.value: Extra Bold

data.name: strFontWeightExtraLight
data.value: Extra Light

data.name: strFontWeightHeavy
data.value: Heavy

data.name: strFontWeightLight
data.value: Light

data.name: strFontWeightMedium
data.value: Medium

data.name: strFontWeightNormal
data.value: Normal

data.name: strFontWeightThin
data.value: Thin

data.name: strGifAnimationContinuously
data.value: Continuously

data.name: strGifAnimationContinuouslyToolTip
data.value: Plays the GIF animation endlessly.

data.name: strGifAnimationNever
data.value: Never

data.name: strGifAnimationNeverToolTip
data.value: Prevents GIFs from being animated. This has no effect on any other animations. However, an option below starts the animation if you mouse over the object.

data.name: strGifAnimationOnce
data.value: Once

data.name: strGifAnimationOnceToolTip
data.value: Plays the GIF animation once, but only once.

data.name: strGifAnimationTwice
data.value: Twice

data.name: strGifAnimationTwiceToolTip
data.value: Plays the GIF animation twice and then stops the animation.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceAnimationAvatarsDesc
data.value: Since many protocols have avatars that can be in GIF format and hence animated, Best Chat makes this a separate preference. If you choose an option that allows limited animation (once or twice), only the latest posts should animate their avatar.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceAnimationAvatarsTitle
data.value: Avatars (can be GIFs)

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceAnimationDesc
data.value: Global location for how to control animations. Use this to tell protocols that can tranfer images how animated images should be handled. Not supported by all protocols. There's a second option below to control if the animation starts or resumes when you mouse over the image or video.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceAnimationGifDesc
data.value: GIF is a format dating to the 1990s created by CompuServe that allows animation. It's limited to 256 colors, but still popular for animations. In some protocols, they can be rather distracting, but important part of memes.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceAnimationGifTitle
data.value: GIF (Graphical Interchange Format)

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceAnimationResumeOnMouseOverDesc
data.value: If checked, animation will resume, or start, when you mouse over an object that can be animated. Otherwise, you'd have to press a play button. (The play button isn't shown for avatars.)

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceAnimationResumeOnMouseOverTitle
data.value: Resume on Mouse Over

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceAnimationTitle
data.value: Animation

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceDisplayCtrlCharsDesc
data.value: If checked, Best Chat will display control characters.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceDisplayCtrlCharsTitle
data.value: Display Control Characters

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceEmojiAnimationDesc
data.value: Use to enable or disable animation of emoji. This is regardless of they arrive as emoji or emoticons. Emoji or emoticons you send are also included. Your theme selects the actual animation used if you enable it.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceEmojiAnimationTitle
data.value: Allow or Disable Animation of Emoji?

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceEmojiDesc
data.value: This is where you configure how Best Chat handles emoji and emoticons.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceEmojiDisplayingDesc
data.value: When Best Chat displays an emoji, it can leave it as is or show the equivalent emoticon instead.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceEmojiDisplayingTitle
data.value: What to do when displaying emoji

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceEmojiSendingDesc
data.value: These choices affect what to do when you enter an emoji. Do you want to send it as is? If you pasted it from somewhere or used an emoji character, you might actually prefer plain ASCII emoticons.. Note: Many emoji can't be represented in ASCII. Those emoji will still be sent as emoji.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceEmojiSendingTitle
data.value: What to do when sending emoji?

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceEmojiTitle
data.value: Emoji

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceEmoticonsDisplayDesc
data.value: When Best Chat displays an emoticon, it can display the raw emoticon or show the equivilant emoji instead. In the latter case, the display option below affects if the emoji is animated. Such animations are selected by your theme.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceEmoticonsDisplayTitle
data.value: What to do when displaying emoticons

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceEmoticonsSendingDesc
data.value: Same as above, but for when you enter emoticons. You can have Best Chat replace those with emoji. Sometimes, the emoticons, especially the older ones, are fater to type

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceEmoticonsSendingTitle
data.value: What to do when sending emoticons?

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceHyphenateLongWordsDesc
data.value: If checked, Best Chat will break up long words on syllable boundaries with hyphens. Otherwise, it will require a space. Turning this off can cause lines to be rather short if really long words are present.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceHyphenateLongWordsTitle
data.value: Hyphenate Long Words

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceMakeEmojiOnlyPostsBiggerDesc
data.value: If checked, posts or messages that contain only emoji as displayed are shown with a bigger font. This also affects animated emoji and includes what arrived as emoticons, but are being shown as emoji. It has no effect on anything displayed as an emoji.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceMakeEmojiOnlyPostsBiggerTitle
data.value: Make Posts With Only Emoji Bigger

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceRecognizeLinksDesc
data.value: If checked, Best Chat will recognize links in plain text including to channels, rooms, servers/networks, web pages, and email addresses. It will then display those links as something you can click on. If unchecked, that won't happen. Note: Some protocols mark links. This setting has no effect on them.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceRecognizeLinksTitle
data.value: Recognize links

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceUseTypographicalQuotesDesc
data.value: If checked, Best Chat will convert conventional quote characters into typographical quotes. Protocols shouldn't apply this to preformatted blocks. Typographical quotes can make the text easier to read. This affects only what's shown. What you send is handled in the Composition page.

data.name: strGlobalAppearanceUseTypographicalQuotesTitle
data.value: Use Typographical Quotes

data.name: strGlobalCompositionDesc
data.value: Contains various settings that control how Best Chat interprets what you type.

data.name: strGlobalCompositionEnableEmojiShortCutsDesc
data.value: If checked, you'll be able to type a string beginning with with a backslash ("\") to open a menu for emoji. This picker may be easier than the one that comes with your OS and cooresponds to what clients for Discord and Matrix include. The menu that appears will filter out those that don't match what you type.

data.name: strGlobalCompositionEnableEmojiShortCutsTitle
data.value: Enable Emoji Short Cuts

data.name: strGlobalCompositionEnableEntityShortCutsDesc
data.value: If checked, you can enter any HTML entity including the ampersand ("&") to send that character. If you know those entities, you may find using this easier than using your OS's character picker. Typing the ampersand will, if this option is enabled, open a menu listing the best match.

data.name: strGlobalCompositionEnableEntityShortCutsTitle
data.value: Enable Entity Short Cuts

data.name: strGlobalCompositionTitle
data.value: Composition

data.name: strGlobalCompositionTreatDblDashAsMDashDesc
data.value: If checked, you'll be able to send a MDash ("—") by typing two consecutive dashes. So use "--". If you uncheck this, you'll need your file picker.

data.name: strGlobalCompositionTreatDblDashAsMDashTitle
data.value: Treat a double dash as an MDash ("—")

data.name: strGlobalCompositionTreatThreePeriodsAsEllipsisDesc
data.value: If checked, you'll be able to type three periods ("...") but get an ellipsis ("…").

data.name: strGlobalCompositionTreatThreePeriodsAsEllipsisTitle
data.value: Treat three periods as an ellipsis ("…")

data.name: strGlobalCompositionUseTypographicalQuotesDesc
data.value: If checked, when you type quotes that aren't in preformatted blocks, Best Chat will replace those with typographical quotes. So "he's" gets replaced with "he’s". Depending on the language, this might not work properly.

data.name: strGlobalCompositionUseTypographicalQuotesTitle
data.value: Use Typographical Quotes
